thread.title: Why were there fireworks in Newcastle city centre on Sunday night?
thread.title_full: Why were there fireworks in Newcastle city centre on Sunday night?

author: Laura Hill
title: Why were there fireworks in Newcastle city centre on Sunday night?
text:
Why were there fireworks in Newcastle city centre on Sunday night? 09:11, 3 Oct 2016 A huge fire work display in Newcastle City Centre prompted many to ask what was going on Share The video will start in 8 s Cancel Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video 
A huge fire work display in Newcastle City Centre on Sunday evening left many people asking what was going on? 
With more than a month until Bonfire Night, onlookers were left puzzled by the 10 minute spectacular near St James’ Park at around 8pm 
The fireworks were planned to mark the closing of the student welcome to the city and were organised by the city’s Business Improvement District, Newcastle NE1. 
Last week was the International Welcome Weeks of Newcastle University , Northumbria University and Newcastle College. 
Students from 152 countries around the world are thought to have descended on the city over the last seven days. Fireworks in Leazes Park, Newcastle Upon Tyne 
The 25-day long welcome to the city was seen as more important this year in light of the UK’s Brexit vote in June. 
Nick Forbes, leader of Newcastle City Council , said: “Newcastle is a global city, and every year we welcome thousands of students from across the world to study here. 
“These students enrich our city while they are here, and many go on to be ambassadors for Newcastle when they graduate. 
“Every successful city in the world has vibrant, talented and diverse universities and students. With Brexit it is still early days, but it is clear that any restrictions the Government makes on overseas students studying here will harm the competitive edge we currently have.” Read More Geordie Shore and Greggs: 11 things you'll learn in your first week at university in Newcastle 
The past two weeks has seen thousands of first year university students move to the Newcastle as they start their degree courses at Northumbria and Newcastle Universities. 
And the students have been spotted around town making the most of the city’s atmosphere and nightlife. 
Whether or not the student’s appreciated all the loud noises after what was likely a hard week of partying remains to be seen. Student accommodation
